item.title: Sample Page
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
This is an example page. It's different from a blog post because it will stay in one place and will show up in your site navigation (in most themes). Most people start with an About page that introduces them to potential site visitors. It might say something like this:
Hi there! I'm a bike messenger by day, aspiring actor by night, and this is my blog. I live in Los Angeles, have a great dog named Jack, and I like piña coladas. (And gettin' caught in the rain.)
...or something like this:
The XYZ Doohickey Company was founded in 1971, and has been providing quality doohickies to the public ever since. Located in Gotham City, XYZ employs over 2,000 people and does all kinds of awesome things for the Gotham community.
As a new WordPress user, you should go to your dashboard to delete this page and create new pages for your content. Have fun!

item.title: Resume
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Email: sahiga at gmail Phone: (310) 433-5137 Location: Los Angeles, CA

Education

University of California Berkeley College of Environmental Design B.A. Architecture, Creative Writing Minor, May 2010

Skills

Web & Graphic DesignRaster: Photoshop, GIMP Vector: Illustrator, Xara, Inkscape Layout: InDesign, LaTeX XHTML, HTML5, CSS WordPress Scientific & Architectural IllustrationPen and ink Graphite Watercolor

Business OperationsAcrobat Salesforce QuickBooks CisionPoint Google Analytics, Google AdWords Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, Google Docs 2D & 3D ModelingAutoCAD Rhinoceros 3D

Experience

Curious Minds | Startup Minds Public Relations Consultant

Technology incubator and accelerator specializing in mobile applications. West Hollywood, CA September 2012-present
  • Acquired international press coverage for BrandBounty, an anti-counterfeiting smartphone application, in MSN News (New Zealand, Australia, Malaysia, Perú), Yahoo! News (Singapore, New Zealand, Germany, Australia), The Standard, Milenio, Süddeutsche.de, La Nación, The Economic Times, and other subscribers of the Agence France-Press.
  • Developed and contributed to the official Startup Minds blog.

Ringadoc Community Manager

Mobile health technology startup with investments from Founders Fund and Practice Fusion. Began as a project within the Curious Minds incubator; relocated to San Francisco in April 2012. San Francisco, CA April 2012 – July 2012
  • Managed a community of 1000+ patients and physicians: recruited and trained a team of 50 physicians to provide remote medical coverage for patients in 14 states; oversaw customer service, including billing, tracking, social media engagement, and a support ticketing system.
  • Managed outreach and operations: created company blog, managed company website and social media presence, interviewed candidates, researched and wrote medical advice for promotional Yahoo! Answers Knowledge Partner profile (90%+ chosen as Best Answer by the community), developed internal user guides, created marketing collateral, acquired and contributed to press coverage in Forbes, GigaOM, VentureBeat, StartUp Beat, and StartupNation.

Curious Minds Business Development & Communications

Technology incubator specializing in telephony and mobile applications. West Hollywood, CA August 2010 – April 2012
  • Founded official company internship program: hired nine interns, directly managed six interns.
  • Created marketing collateral: press releases, website copy, advertisements, landing pages.
  • Acted as primary contact for vendors, customers, and press for the incubator's health technology projects and was selected to relocate with the Ringadoc project to San Francisco.<

Internships

  • Heyday Books, Marketing and Publicity Berkeley, CA, January 2010 – April 2010 Designed and installed a 4'x18' front-of-office display to celebrate company history, wrote pitch letters and press releases, formatted and compiled e-newsletter for mailing list, finalized promotional interactive map, designed events webpage, contributed to Heyday blog.
  • Story Hour in the Library Berkeley, CA, January 2008 – May 2009 Wrote promotional biographies for upcoming participants in the Story Hour fiction reading series, designed fliers to advertise special sponsored events, promoted readings.
  • Mattel Corporation, Sales El Segundo, CA, September 2005 – January 2006 Computer financial forecasts, created sales sheets, rewrote administrative manual for the B2B sales site to clarify process of purchasing items in bulk for prospective retailers.

Activities & Honors

  • "eclec · ti · cism: art across the majors" – Exhibited Artist, Worth Ryder Gallery, March 2010
  • Third Annual Creative Writing Minor Celebratory Student Reading – Participant, 2010
  • Inter-City Services – Volunteer Income Tax Preparer (Basic IRS VITA/TCE Certification), 2010
  • UC Berkeley College of Environmental Design Peer Advising – Treasurer, Fall 2008; Human Resources Manager, Spring 2009
  • Fashion and Student Trends – Designer, Fall 2008
  • Cal Lobby Day – Group Leader, 2007
  • The English Speaking Union, Los Angeles Branch Shakespeare Essay Competition – 2nd Place, 2006

item.title: Projects
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Objected (under construction)

Objected is a gallery documenting inanimate object torture. Inanimate objects are easy targets because they do not show feelings as animals do. We can destroy them without suffering guilt afterward. We destroy them without even knowing. We might even think them the natural slaves of the animate that created them. Even when we don’t try, we force them into subjection. This project does not chronicle everyday accidents. No. The objects in these photos have all been tortured on purpose. Maliciously. Without regard for their dignity and original form. This is a gallery of damages.

Shadestoppers (under construction)

I make sculptures from leftover objects sitting around my house. All these sculptures vaguely resemble glasses (wearable kind) and are built with glue guns and X-acto blades — no drilling, cutting, or welding machines. This is because I am cheap and afraid of sharp moving things. I also make virtual glasses in 3D modeling programs.

item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
WELCO
METOMY
WORLD

I'm a writer based in Los Angeles, California.

I currently work on content strategy at a mobile technology incubator-accelerator on the Sunset Strip.

In my spare time, I wrangle text, symbols, and pictures.

Samuel R. Delany's Dhalgren is my favorite novel, followed closely by V. and Hard-Boiled Wonderland and the End of the World.

Coming soon: a wiki!
